leftSection.title: Same-Day Service Windows
leftSection.description: We reserve emergency slots every day to handle urgent leaks, backups, and no-water situations—often resolved on the first visit.

rightSection.title: How to Handle a Plumbing Emergency
rightSection.description: Shut off water at the nearest valve, cut power to affected equipment if safe, avoid using fixtures tied to the issue, and call us at [phone] for step-by-step guidance.

lists.comapreHeading: What Can We Fix During an Emergency Visit?
allowedItems: Burst or leaking pipes (copper, PEX, CPVC)
Leaking water heaters and failed shut-off valves
Gas leaks and appliance flex line issues (where permitted)
prohibitedItems: Non-urgent cosmetic upgrades during emergency dispatch
Work requiring city permits outside emergency stabilization
Roofing or structural repairs unrelated to plumbing
idealProjects: Active water leak causing ceiling/wall damage
No hot water before business hours or weekends
Sewage smell or backup in tubs, toilets, or floor drains
Gas odor near water heater, stove, or furnace lines
